back.title: company, corporation
back.description: A business organization or commercial enterprise.

back.title: enterprise, business
back.description: A company or organization engaged in commercial activity.

back.title: business, commerce
back.description: Commercial activities or trade in general.

back.title: trade
back.description: The activity of buying and selling goods and services.

back.title: market
back.description: A place or system where goods and services are exchanged.

back.title: economy, economic
back.description: The system of production, distribution, and consumption of goods.

back.title: finance, fiscal
back.description: Management of money and financial resources.

back.title: bank
back.description: A financial institution that handles money transactions.

back.title: investment, invest
back.description: The allocation of money expecting future returns.

back.title: profit
back.description: Financial gain from business activities.

back.title: loss, deficit
back.description: Financial loss or negative earnings.

back.title: income, revenue
back.description: Money received from business or employment.

back.title: expenditure, expenses
back.description: Money spent on business operations.

back.title: cost, expense
back.description: The amount spent to produce goods or services.

back.title: price
back.description: The amount charged for goods or services.

back.title: quotation, quote
back.description: A statement of the price for goods or services.

back.title: negotiation, negotiate
back.description: Discussion to reach an agreement on business terms.

back.title: contract, agreement
back.description: A legally binding business agreement.

back.title: sign, conclude
back.description: To formally sign a contract or agreement.

back.title: transaction, deal
back.description: A business exchange or commercial deal.

back.title: sales, selling
back.description: The process of selling products or services.

back.title: procurement, purchasing
back.description: The process of acquiring goods or services for business.

back.title: supply, provide
back.description: To provide goods or services to customers.

back.title: demand, requirement
back.description: Customer need or desire for products/services.

back.title: client, customer
back.description: A person or company that purchases goods or services.

back.title: supplier, vendor
back.description: A company that provides goods or services to other businesses.

back.title: business partner
back.description: A company or individual collaborating in business ventures.

back.title: competitor, rival
back.description: A business competing for the same market or customers.

back.title: product
back.description: Goods or items produced for sale.

back.title: service
back.description: Work performed for customers or clients.

back.title: quality
back.description: The standard or grade of products or services.

back.title: brand
back.description: A trademark or commercial identity of products.

back.title: advertisement, advertising
back.description: Promotional messages to attract customers.

back.title: marketing
back.description: Activities to promote and sell products or services.

back.title: promotion, promote
back.description: Activities to increase awareness and sales.

back.title: production, manufacture
back.description: The process of making goods or products.

back.title: processing, manufacture
back.description: The transformation of raw materials into finished products.

back.title: manufacture, make
back.description: To produce goods in factories or workshops.

back.title: inventory, stock
back.description: Goods held in storage for sale or distribution.

back.title: transportation, shipping
back.description: The movement of goods from one place to another.

back.title: logistics
back.description: The planning and execution of goods movement and storage.

back.title: delivery, deliver
back.description: The act of providing goods or services to customers.

back.title: receive goods
back.description: The act of accepting delivered goods or products.

back.title: inspection, examine
back.description: The process of checking quality and compliance.

back.title: certificate, proof
back.description: Official documentation verifying compliance or quality.

back.title: license, permit
back.description: Official authorization to conduct business activities.

back.title: policy
back.description: Official rules or guidelines governing business operations.

back.title: regulations, rules
back.description: Legal requirements and standards for business conduct.

back.title: insurance
back.description: Financial protection against business risks and losses.

back.title: risk
back.description: Potential for financial loss or business failure.

back.title: management, manage
back.description: The process of controlling and organizing business operations.

back.title: manager
back.description: A person responsible for managing business operations.

back.title: president, CEO
back.description: The highest-ranking executive in a company.

back.title: director
back.description: A member of the board governing a company.

back.title: executive, senior management
back.description: High-level managers responsible for strategic decisions.

back.title: employee, staff
back.description: People working for a company or organization.

back.title: colleague, coworker
back.description: People working together in the same organization.

back.title: team
back.description: A group of people working together toward common goals.

back.title: department, division
back.description: A distinct section or unit within an organization.

back.title: position, job title
back.description: A specific role or rank within an organization.

back.title: responsibility, duty
back.description: Tasks and obligations assigned to a job position.

back.title: salary, wages
back.description: Compensation paid to employees for their work.

back.title: salary increase, raise
back.description: An increase in employee compensation.

back.title: bonus
back.description: Additional compensation based on performance or achievements.

back.title: benefits, welfare
back.description: Additional compensation and services provided to employees.

back.title: reimbursement, expense claim
back.description: Compensation for business expenses incurred by employees.

back.title: business trip
back.description: Travel for work-related purposes.

back.title: meeting, conference
back.description: A gathering of people for business discussions.

back.title: report
back.description: A formal document presenting business information or analysis.

back.title: plan, planning
back.description: A detailed proposal for achieving business objectives.

back.title: goal, target, objective
back.description: A specific aim or result that a business wants to achieve.

back.title: budget
back.description: A plan for allocating financial resources.

back.title: forecast, prediction
back.description: An estimate of future business conditions or performance.

back.title: analysis, analyze
back.description: The detailed examination of business data or situations.

back.title: data
back.description: Information used for business analysis and decision-making.

back.title: statistics
back.description: Numerical data and analysis for business insights.

back.title: record, documentation
back.description: Written accounts of business transactions or activities.

back.title: document
back.description: Official papers or electronic files containing business information.

back.title: project
back.description: A temporary undertaking to create a unique product or service.

back.title: task, assignment
back.description: A specific piece of work to be completed.

back.title: progress, process
back.description: The advancement or development of work or projects.

back.title: solve, resolve
back.description: To find solutions to business problems or challenges.

back.title: problem, issue, question
back.description: Challenges or difficulties in business operations.

back.title: challenge
back.description: Difficult tasks or situations requiring effort to overcome.

back.title: opportunity, chance
back.description: Favorable circumstances for business growth or success.

back.title: success, successful
back.description: The achievement of business goals or objectives.

back.title: failure, fail
back.description: The lack of success in achieving business objectives.

back.title: improve, enhancement
back.description: To make changes that result in better business performance.

back.title: innovation, innovate
back.description: The introduction of new ideas, methods, or products in business.

back.title: development, growth
back.description: The process of expanding or improving business operations.

back.title: expansion, expand
back.description: The process of increasing business size, scope, or reach.

back.title: growth, increase
back.description: An increase in business size, revenue, or market share.

back.title: decrease, reduce
back.description: To make or become smaller in amount, size, or degree.

back.title: stable, stability
back.description: Consistent and predictable business conditions.

back.title: change, transformation
back.description: Alterations in business conditions, strategies, or operations.

back.title: trend, tendency
back.description: General direction of market or business developments.

back.title: future
back.description: Time period ahead and business prospects for that time.

back.title: strategy, strategic
back.description: Long-term plans and approaches for achieving business goals.

back.title: tactics, strategy
back.description: Specific methods or approaches used to achieve objectives.

back.title: operate, management
back.description: The running and management of business operations.

back.title: operations, operate
back.description: The day-to-day functioning of business activities.

back.title: efficiency
back.description: The ability to accomplish tasks with minimal waste of resources.

back.title: effect, result
back.description: The outcome or impact of business actions or strategies.

back.title: influence, impact
back.description: The effect that actions or decisions have on business outcomes.

back.title: function, role
back.description: The purpose or effect of something in business operations.

back.title: value, worth
back.description: The importance, usefulness, or monetary worth of something.

back.title: contact, connection
back.description: Communication or relationship between business parties.

back.title: relationship, connection
back.description: The way in which business entities are connected or related.

back.title: cooperation, collaborate
back.description: Working together with others to achieve common business goals.

back.title: competition, compete
back.description: Rivalry between businesses for customers, market share, or resources.

back.title: advantage, strength
back.description: Beneficial factors that give a business competitive edge.

back.title: disadvantage, weakness
back.description: Factors that put a business at a competitive disadvantage.

back.title: requirement, demand
back.description: Conditions or standards that must be met in business.

back.title: condition, terms
back.description: Circumstances or requirements for business agreements.

back.title: standard, criterion
back.description: Established levels of quality or achievement in business.

back.title: standard, norm
back.description: Established rules or guidelines for business conduct.

back.title: formal, official
back.description: Following established business protocols and procedures.

back.title: informal, unofficial
back.description: Casual or non-official business communications or meetings.

back.title: professional, specialized
back.description: Relating to expert knowledge or skilled business practice.

back.title: experience, background
back.description: Past events or activities that provide business knowledge.

back.title: background, context
back.description: The circumstances or history relevant to business situations.

back.title: situation, circumstances
back.description: The current state or condition of business affairs.

back.title: state, status
back.description: The current condition or position of business operations.

back.title: level, standard
back.description: The degree or quality of business performance or capability.

back.title: degree, extent
back.description: The amount or level to which business conditions apply.

back.title: scope, range
back.description: The extent or boundaries of business activities or responsibilities.

back.title: scale, size
back.description: The extent or magnitude of business operations.

back.title: message, news
back.description: Information or communication shared in business.

back.title: notice, notification
back.description: Official announcement or communication to employees or stakeholders.

back.title: announcement, bulletin
back.description: Public statement about company matters or changes.

back.title: approval, authorize
back.description: The process of reviewing and approving business decisions.

back.title: approve, ratify
back.description: To formally agree to or accept a business proposal.

back.title: reject, refuse
back.description: To decline or deny a business request or proposal.

back.title: cancel, revoke
back.description: To call off or nullify a business arrangement.

back.title: correct, revise
back.description: To make changes to improve or fix business documents.

back.title: modify, amend
back.description: To make alterations to business plans or agreements.

back.title: update, refresh
back.description: To bring business information or systems up to date.

back.title: upgrade, promote
back.description: To improve systems, products, or employee positions.

back.title: downgrade, demote
back.description: To reduce the level or status of business elements.

back.title: transfer, shift
back.description: To move resources, responsibilities, or operations.

back.title: allocate, distribute
back.description: To assign resources or tasks among different areas.

back.title: arrange, schedule
back.description: To organize and plan business activities or meetings.

back.title: organize, organization
back.description: To structure and coordinate business activities or entities.

back.title: institution, organization
back.description: A formal business or administrative organization.

back.title: office, agency
back.description: A government or administrative office.

back.title: unit, organization
back.description: A work unit or organizational entity.

back.title: government
back.description: The governing body that regulates business activities.

back.title: country, nation
back.description: A sovereign state with its own business regulations.

back.title: international
back.description: Relating to business activities between countries.

back.title: global, worldwide
back.description: Relating to business activities across the entire world.

back.title: local, domestic
back.description: Relating to business activities within one's own country.

back.title: overseas, abroad
back.description: Relating to business activities in foreign countries.

back.title: import
back.description: To bring goods or services from foreign countries.

back.title: export
back.description: To send goods or services to foreign countries.

back.title: customs
back.description: Government agency controlling import and export of goods.

back.title: tariff, duty
back.description: Tax imposed on imported or exported goods.
